text: Job’s Fifth Speech, Continued
“My spirit is pulled down; my days are extinguished;
\add the\add* graveyard \add is\add* for me.
⸤Surely⸥\f + \fr 17:2 \ft Literally “If not” \f* mockery \add is\add* with me,
and my eye ⸤rests⸥\f + \fr 17:2 \ft Literally “spends the night” \f* on their provocation.
Please lay down a pledge for me with yourself;
who \add is\add* he \add who\add* will give security for my hand?\f + \fr 17:3 \ft Or “who will give security for me?” \f*
Indeed,\f + \fr 17:4 \ft Or “For” \f* you have closed their mind from understanding;
therefore, you will not let \add them\add* triumph.
He denounces friends for reward,
so\f + \fr 17:5 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* his children’s eyes will fail.
“And he has made me a proverb for\f + \fr 17:6 \ft Hebrew “of” \f* \add the\add* peoples,
⸤and I am one before whom people spit⸥.\f + \fr 17:6 \ft Literally “and spitting to the faces I am” \f*
And my eye has grown dim from grief,
and the limbs of my body \add are\add* all\f + \fr 17:7 \ft Hebrew “all of them” \f* like a shadow.
\add The\add* upright are appalled at this,
and \add the\add* innocent excites himself over \add the\add* godless.
But\f + \fr 17:9 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* \add the\add* righteous holds on to his way,
and ⸤he who has clean hands⸥\f + \fr 17:9 \ft Literally “the clean of hands” \f* increases in strength.

But\f + \fr 17:10 \ft Literally “And but” \f* ⸤all of you must return⸥\f + \fr 17:10 \ft Literally “all of them you must return” \f*—⸤please come⸥!\f + \fr 17:10 \ft Literally “and please come,” or “come on!” \f*
But\f + \fr 17:10 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* I shall not find a wise \add person\add* among you.
“My days are past; my plans are broken down—
\add even\add* the desires of my heart.
They make night into day,
\add saying\add*, ‘Light \add is\add* ⸤near to darkness⸥.’\f + \fr 17:12 \ft Literally “near from the faces of darkness” \f*
If I hope \add for\add* Sheol \add as\add* my house,
\add if\add* I spread my couch in the darkness,
\add if\add* I call to the pit, ‘You \add are\add* my father,’
to the maggot, ‘\add You are\add* my mother or\f + \fr 17:14 \ft Or “and” \f* my sister,’
where\f + \fr 17:15 \ft Hebrew “and where” \f* then \add is\add* my hope?
And ⸤who will see my hope⸥?\f + \fr 17:15 \ft Literally “my hope who will see it” \f*
Will they go down \add to\add* the bars of Sheol?
Or shall we descend together into the dust?”
